intro: Areca elaeocarpa, commonly known as the white areca or white palm, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by bright red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Areca elaeocarpa thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and ample sunlight.
